poem:
Title: "In the Wake of Ashes"

Beneath the steel birds' fury-scarred sky,
In Rafah, children no longer fly kites;
Only embers, soaring in dreamless plight.
Their playground now a sigh of smoke and sorrow,
A cruel eye dons the mask of tomorrow.
Lamentations adrift on the ancient wind,
A bleak tableau on God's cinema, unpinned.
Injustice renders the olive tree bereft,
For the Promised Land is deaf.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Global shock after Israeli airstrike kills dozens in Rafah tent camp An Israeli airstrike that caused a huge blaze at a tented area for displaced people in Rafah has killed 45 people, medics have said, with images of charred and dismembered children prompting an outcry from global leaders and putting ceasefire talks in jeopardy. Bombing overnight that the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said targeted senior Hamas militants in a precision strike appears to have ignited". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
